summary: This is an email chain from June 29, 2022, between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding coordination for the recovery of a fine imposed as part of Ghislaine Maxwell's sentence. It involves introducing a Financial Litigation Asset Investigator and an FBI agent to assist with locating accounts for asset recovery.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Author of an email coordinating recovery efforts for the fine imposed as part of Ghislaine Maxwell's sentence, copying an FBI agent to assist with account information.

persons.name: Lubin
persons.context: FBI agent copied on an email to coordinate regarding information about current accounts for asset recovery related to Maxwell's sentence.

connections.description: Alison, a Deputy Chief in the Criminal Division, copies FBI agent Lubin on an email to coordinate information sharing for asset recovery related to Maxwell's sentence.

events.title: Maxwell sentencing
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was sentenced, which included the imposition of a fine, prompting recovery coordination efforts.

keyFacts: The email is dated June 29, 2022, the day after Ghislaine Maxwell's sentencing.
The correspondence focuses on recovering a fine imposed as part of Maxwell's sentence.
An FBI agent (Lubin) is involved to help coordinate information about current accounts for asset recovery.
The communication is between personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
A Financial Litigation Asset Investigator is introduced to assist with the recovery process.
